divs: sighting detailsit was a sundy in mid-september 1999, although i can't recall exactly which one, but i was driving on a frontage road, facing west, right around willow rd. and maybe patriot blvd. can't recall exactly. i stopped at an intersection for a red light, i was the only one there since it was a weekend and i was leaving an industrial park where practically nobody was working that day. it was a sunny day, with high, white clouds moving fairly quickly through the sky,and as i sat at the light i noticed a large passenger plane flying towards my direction in the distance, preparing to land at o'hare airport, which was a few miles behind me. the clouds opened behind the plane to reveal a huge, metallic\mirrored sphere, at least it looked like a sphere, altough i could only see about what appeared to be about 75% of it because of the clouds. the plane was flying towards me, right in front of the object, and comparing the sizes, i figured that the object was at least fifteen times the size of the plane from my view (meaning, you could have stacked fifteen planes on top of each other in order to reach the height of the sphere), but it was certainly a good distance behind the plane, well out over the lake, so it was probably much bigger than that. it was in my view for about fifteen seconds(i do remember actually counting when i saw it)and then quickly moving clouds slid in front of it and blocked my view. i never saw it again. i remember feeling pretty shook-up after seeing that thing.

Summary: Huge sphere with metallic/mirrored panels all over it.
